New Records: Rohit Sharma broke the record for the lowest total when a batter has brought up half-century in T20Is, where ball-by-ball data is available.
Rohit Sharma became the first man to get to 200 sixes in T20Is.
Rohit Sharma hit the most sixes by an Indian in an innings in the T20 World Cup.
Rohit Sharma reached his fastest fifty in all T20s in 19 balls.
Rohit Sharma scored 50 of India's 52 runs, which is a T20I record for the lowest team score when a batter's made a half-century where ball-by-ball data is available.
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma scored 76 of his 92 runs in boundaries and left Australia with nowhere to hide.
Rohit Sharma was sublime and took the game away from Australia.
Rohit Sharma was yorked by Mitchell Starc for 92 off 41.
David Warner fell flirting with a ball outside his off stump, completely done by Arshdeep Singh's away swing.
Mitchell Marsh, much like Rohit Sharma did earlier, has decided an early wicket is no reason to pull back.
Jasprit Bumrah took 15 runs from two overs for Bumrah today, already his second-most expensive outing in the T20 World Cup.
Kuldeep Yadav bowled an incredible googly to deceive Glenn Maxwell and take his wicket.
Axar Patel took a blinder to dismiss Mitchell Marsh.
Travis Head fell to Jasprit Bumrah's slower ball.
Virat Kohli fell to Josh Hazlewood's short ball for 0 off 5.
India won the match by 24 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Mitchell Marsh says he's looking at a belter.
Mitchell Starc back in for Ashton Agar.
Rohit says he would've wanted to field too.
Rohit puts a premium on them adapting to the challenges in front of them.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma was sublime and took the game away from Australia.
India won the match by 24 runs.
Rohit Sharma broke multiple records in the match.
Rohit Sharma became the first man to get to 200 sixes in T20Is.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch is the same one used for the England vs South Africa game where 163 was defended.
The boundaries are even, approx 60-70m around the park.
The weather's a lot cooler, perhaps even enough to suggest a bit of swing in the air.
The cross-winds are forever a factor.
